DOC.brief_summary: The overall goal randomize controlled trial test efficacy culturally linguistically modify , individually tailor lifestyle intervention reduce excess gestational weight gain ( GWG ) , increase postpartum weight loss , improve maternal metabolic status among overweight/obese Hispanic woman . Specific aims evaluate impact intervention 1 ) GWG postpartum weight loss , 2 ) pregnancy postpartum biomarkers insulin resistance ( i.e. , glucose , insulin , HbA1c , HOMA , leptin , adiponectin ) , 3 ) postpartum biomarkers cardiovascular risk ( i.e. , blood lipid , blood pressure ) , 4 ) offspring outcome ( i.e. , anthropometric measure biomarkers insulin resistance ) , 5 ) evaluate cost-effectiveness intervention per average incremental improvement outcome variable . Overweight/obese Hispanic woman recruit early pregnancy ( around 10 wks gestation ) randomly assign Lifestyle Intervention ( n=150 ) Comparison Health Wellness ( control ) Intervention ( n=150 ) . The intervention utilize exercise ( R01NR011295 ) dietary intervention material ( R18DK067549 ) culturally adapt Hispanics show efficacious previous control trial ethnic group . Multimodal contact ( i.e. , in-person , telephone counseling , mail print-based material ) use deliver intervention pregnancy ( ~12 wks gestation delivery ) continue postpartum ( ~6 wks 6 mo postpartum ) ; follow-up continue one year postpartum . Targets intervention achieve Institute Medicine Guidelines GWG postpartum weight loss ; ACOG guideline physical activity increase walk develop active lifestyle ; reduction total calorie follow balance healthy diet compliance American Diabetes Association guideline . The intervention draw Social Cognitive Theory Transtheoretical Model include strategy partner and/or family support address specific social , cultural , economic challenge face underserved Hispanic woman . Measures compliance include actigraphs Hispanic food frequency questionnaire . The propose project build upon expertise investigative team conduct randomize controlled trial exercise intervention among Hispanic pregnant woman ( R01 DK074876 ) dietary intervention among low-income Hispanics type 2 diabetes ( R18 DK0658850 ) readily translate clinical practice underserved minority population .
DOC.brief_title: Lifestyle Intervention Overweight Obese Pregnant Hispanic Women
DOC.criteria: Hispanic woman Overweight obese pregnancy ( BMI > 25 kg/m2 ) 1645 year old history type 2 diabetes , heart disease , chronic renal disease contraindication participation moderate physical activity lowfat/highfiber diet ( e.g. , Crohn 's disease , ulcerative colitis ) inability read English Spanish 6th grade level > 20 wks gestation current medication adversely influence glucose tolerance planning continue term deliver study site pregnant twin triplet preterm birth ( < 34 wks ) , miscarriage , still birth enrollment stillbirth woman become pregnant year follow delivery censor time positive pregnancy test
